Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Corticostatin-related peptide RK-1 (RK-1; lagomorphs, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: RK-1 consists of 32 residues, including six cysteines arranged into three disulfide bonds. The three-dimensional solution structure, determined by NMR, consists of a triple-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet and a series of turns and is similar to the known structures of other alpha-defensins (Ref.3).
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity against Escherichia coli and activates Ca(2+) channels in vitro.

Literature.Title: The isolation and characterization of a novel corticostatin/defensin-like peptide from the kidney.
Literature.Author: Bateman A, MacLeod RJ, Lembessis P, Hu J, Esch F, Solomon S.

Literature.Title: Three-dimensional structure of RK-1 a novel alpha-defensin peptide.
Literature.Author: McManus AM, Dawson NF, Wade JD, Carrington LE, Winzor DJ, Craik DJ.

Literature.Title: Three-dimensional structure of RK-1: a novel alpha-defensin peptide.
Literature.Author: Winzor D.J.,Carrington L.E.,Wade J.D.,Dawson N.F.,McManus A.M.
